result.execSummary:
The defendant John C. Featherston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.  ***Costs imposed include witness fees of $49.62.***
Defendant to undergo a Psychological Evaluation that is coordinated through the Waushara Co Verterans Service Office due to veteran status.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is not to be in possession of  any alcohol or reside in any residence that has alcohol on the premises.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the victim as named in the complaint.  Should victim wish to have contact, written request is to be provided to the supervising agent for the agent to approve contact.   Defendant is not to possess any type of weapon, i.e., any dangerous device that is intended to cause harm to someone else.   Defendant is also prohibited from having any contact with the Waushara Co District Attorney's Office, no contact in writing or by telephone.

DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  Pursuant to s. 968.20, The Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the seized Remington 870 Express 12 Gauge Shotgun, Serial #172314M (with camouflage sling), only after the period of post conviction relief has expired.  The Remington Model 7400, 270 Caliber Rifle with a 3-9x32 Tasco Scope, Serial #8123567 is ordered returned to the owner, only after the period of post conviction relief has expired.

Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent, including but not limited to inpatient treatment that is available.

timeConds.notes: No Good Time Credit.  Court does not grant Huber Privileges.   Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.

supervisions.notes: Court finds eligible for Substance Abuse Program if not offense ineligible.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo a Psychological Evaluation and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with C. Featherston, unless authorized through supervising agent and with victims approval. The defendant is not to possess any weapons, including but not limited to firearms.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Defendant is to participate in Mental Health and Substance Abuse Counseling through the Veterans Administration.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Court re-imposes costs not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.

3:27 pm case called. Defendant John C. Featherston in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding revocation order and warrant. Statement by Attorney Zamzow regarding withdrawal of attorney due to defendant requesting her withdrawal. Court questions defendant regarding counsel-defendant wishes to proceed without counsel. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant states he will proceed with counsel. Court reinstates counsel for the proceeding today. Counsel have received the revocation order and warrant-no additions or corrections. Court questions victim regarding statement-will not be making one. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Zamzow. Statement by defendant. Court makes statement and sentences the defendant to: 7.5 years (90 months) Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 2.5 years (30 month)  Initial Confinement and 5 years (60 months) Extended Supervision. Credit for 471 days credit for time served. CONDITIONS of ES: Psychological evaluation and follow through. Participate in Mental health and Substance Abuse Counseling through Veterans Administration. No Contact with C. Featherston, unless authorized through agent and only in writing, Absolute sobriety, No bars, No Rx w/o valid Rx, AODA and follow through, No weapons including but not limited to firearms, Terms of Agent, Costs re-imposed if not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court finds not eligible for CIP but eligible for SAP if not offense ineligible. Appeal Rights Given.

Case Called @ 2:30 PM: Defendant John C. Featherston in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim makes statement to the Court prior to sentencing.  Def's older sister (C. Cerney) makes statement to the Court prior to sentencing.  Argument as to SEH by DA Blader.  Argument as to SEH by Atty Belville. Statement by Def: Defendant attempts to read his statement.  Court then reviews his written statement.   The Court: S/W - 5 yrs probation.  Conditions:  1 yr WCJ, 243 days TS credit (Court explains the law of imposition of Cond'l Jail and application of TS credit), No Work Release Privileges balance to be served forthwith; Complete an AODA and any follow thru as deemed appropriate, including but not limited to inpatient treatment that is available; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, Not to be in the possession of any alcohol or reside in any residence that has alcohol on the premises; may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; undergo a Psych Eval that is coordinated thru WC VSO due to veteran status; No contact with C Featherston unless written authorization is provided to the supervising agent by victim - agent must agree with her request for contact; no possession of any type of weapon i.e., any dangerous device that is intended to cause harm to someone else; no contact with the Waushara Co DA, in writing or by telephone; Court Costs, plus DNA Sample/Surcharge ordered.  Right to expunge DNA record explained through the Dept of Justice.  Collateral consequences explained.  Remington 12 Gauge ordered destroyed after period of post conviction relief has expired.  Remington 270 ordered returned after period of post conviction relief has expired.  Appeal Rights Given.
Inmate Request to the Court - Denied
Inmate Request to Court-Clerk responded -fee for separation papers packet provided
Inmate Request to the Court - Denied
Sentencing hearing on September 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

9:09 am case called. Defendant John C. Featherston in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Defendant John C. Featherston in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding sentencing hearing. Attorney Belville makes statement regarding request for modification of bond-hired an expert and due to expert timelines was not available for today's hearing. Statement by DA Blader and requests expert information be provided. State objects to bond modification and makes statement regarding objection. Court questions Attorney Belville regarding motion and request to modify bond. Court declines to modify bond. Court questions Attorney Belville regarding expert. Statement by Attorney Belville regarding expert and medical records. Court makes statement to counsel. Court revokes bond and adjourns sentencing for evaluations to be completed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

8:23 am case called. Defendant John C. Featherston in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the matter on the calendar for today. Attorney Belville objects again to the other acts motion previously denied. Court affirms other act evidence and respectfully declines to revist the matter. Instruction 275 addressed with counsel-will address after State's direct. 8:40 am Entire panel sworn by clerk-Voir Dire begins. 8:49 am State begins. 9:10 Attorney Belville begins. 9:45 am Peremptory Strikes. 10:00 am Court recesses. 10:20 Court recalls matter-same appearance. Opening Statement by State. Opening Statement by Attorney Belville. 10:38 am. State calls C. Featherston, witness sworn, testimony given. Record reflects positive identification of the defendant. Exhibit #1, #3, #4, #5, #6, #7, #8, #9 offered and received. 11:26 am Cross exam by Attorney Belville, further testimony given. Exhibit #10 & # 11. Exhibit #11 offered and denied. 11:51 am Re-direct by State. 11:55 am Re-Cross by Attorney Belville. 11:56 am Witness excused. Court discusses jury instructions. 1:08 pm case recalled. Jury returned to court room. State calls Officer Scott Rasmussen, witness sworn by Clerk, testimony given. Exhibit #12, #13, #14 offered and received.  1:30 pm Cross by Attorney Belville. 1:40 Court questions defendant regarding right of allocution and accepts the defendant exercising his right to testify.  Motion to dismiss by Attorney Belville. Court denies motion to dismiss and makes statement regarding denial. 1:46 pm State rests. Defense begins case in chief. Attorney Belville calls John Featherston, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross by State. 2:15 Evidence is closed. Instruction conference held. 2:41 pm jury returned to court room. Court instructs jurors. 3:00 pm Closing argument by State. Closing argument by Attorney Belville. Bailiffs charged. Jury begins deliberation at 3:40 pm. 4:20 pm case recalled-jury returned-Jury finds the defendant Guilty as charged with Domestic Abuse Enhancer. Court polls juror-each juror confirms verdict and verdict of jury as a whole. Court instructs the jury and excuses them from service. DA Blader moves for judgment on the verdict. Court enters JOC.  Court questions counsel regarding PSI-State does not wish to have one completed. Attorney Belville has discussed PSI and defendant has not position. Court does not order a PSI to be completed. Court revokes bond and remands the defendant to the custody of the Waushara County Jail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant and Atty Belville appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 3:19 p.m. Defendant John C. Featherston in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Amanda M. Belville.   Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing scheduled in advance of the trial to address final pre-trial motions. Atty Belville - DE is requesting that Atty Belville no longer represent him on this matter. Statement by DE. Statement by Atty Belville. The Court advises the defendant that he must either continue with Atty Belville representing him or proceed to trial without counsel. The Court finds that the DE's requesting for Atty Belville's withdrawal is unfounded and is just a tactic to delay the trial. The Court directs that Atty Belville remain as counsel of record on this matter. The Court addresses the briefs filed by DA Blader and response filed by Atty Belville regarding Other Acts Evidence. The Court orders that the evidence is question is admissible.

Case Called @ 11:42 AM: Defendant John C. Featherston in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Defendant John C. Featherston in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Trial remains on as scheduled for 6/29.  As to s. 904.04(2)(b)(1) - 2 step Sullivan analysis on admissibility discussed - other acts admissible - 2 step Sullivan analysis, not 3.  As to 2010 case Court sees as admissible subject to further analysis by Atty Belville.  As to other acts:  No objection to number of convictions.  The Court:  Offered evidence admissible for impeachment purposes in the event Def chooses to testify.  Previous convictions admitted as other acts and appropriately introduced for impeachment purposes.  Court will permit impeachment should Def testify with a bifurcated line of questioning.  State would then be foreclosed from any further introduction of evidence on this issue with Def's proper answers.  Atty Belville requests Def be addressed by name only at trial for prejudicial purposes.  The Court:  Explains general practice as reference to victim as complainant only.  Generally speaking Defendant will be referred to by name most times.  Counsel's request is not inappropriate.  All MIL's granted.  Court discusses trial mechanics with counsel.  4 pre-emptive strikes per party - 1 provisional juror - 13 Jurors coupled with the pre-emptive - 23 on the panel for voir dire.  32 jurors to be summoned.  Memorialization of plea agreement offered and rejected by the State.  Atty Belville confirms agreement offered and Def's wishes to reject same.  Def confirms rejection of plea agreement.  State to put forth written plea offer to the Court, executed by Atty Belville and Def and kept under seal in the file pending JT.

10:58 am case called. Defendant John C. Featherston in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant John C. Featherston in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions if preliminary hearing proceeding. Counsel confirm. Cyanne Featherston called by State, witness sworn, testimony given. Record reflects positive identification of defendant. Witness excused. Argument by Attorney Szilagyi. Court makes statement and finds the record reflects sufficient evidence for probable cause to be found, finds probable cause and enters an order binging the defendant over for trial. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD.
